intro: Pulsatilla patens var. krzemionkiensis, commonly known as the Krzemionkiensis Pasqueflower, is a rare and endemic variety of the pasqueflower found primarily in specific regions of Central Europe. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its early spring blooming period, typically emerging in late March to early April. The plant features showy, showy, pinkish-white flowers with a distinctive crown-like structure, and its leaves are basal, hairy, and lanceolate in shape. It thrives in calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some areas.
